title: ELECTRICITY and MAGNETISM
competencies: describe the different kinds of magnets and their properties;
list some uses of permanent magnets;
explain what is meant by magnetic field and how it is detected;
show how magnetic fields and electric currents are related;
describe the way an electromagnet is made and the kind of magnetic field it produces;
state the effect that a magnetic field has on electric current;
recognize the conditions under which a magnetic field can be used to produce electric current;
explain how the interaction of magnetic fields produces movement in a motor;
describe a generator and the way it produces electric energy; and
describe a transformer and explain how it works.

title: ELECTROMAGNETIC SPECTRUM
competencies: trace the development of the electromagnetic theory.
describe how electromagnetic (EM) wave is produced and propagated.
compare the relative wavelengths, frequencies and energies of the different regions of the electromagnetic spectrum.
cite examples of practical applications of the different regions of EM waves.
explain the effects of electromagnetic radiation on living things and the environment.
